Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Tiziano”
Reviews.Author: HM--traveling
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tiziano with our two teenaged sons in Spring 2010. We thoroughly enjoyed staying at this beautiful hotel. Lovely accommodations -- we were traveling on a moderate budget and it was the nicest hotel by far that we stayed at in Italy. A travel company booked our hotels, so we didn't research it much, but we were very satisfied. It apparently was built as a home in the 1500s, was apartments, and then renovated as a hotel about 5 years ago. It's in the Dorsodoro area, so is a bit off the touristy area, but we enjoyed the quiet location and got to see areas that we might not have otherwise. Large windows look over an open area and a small canal. Getting there was a little tricky rolling our suitcases behind us! (We got to use the "Universal language" in asking some locals how to get there--we had good directions, but missed a turn and went too far). If you go, download a map and look for detailed directions ("streets" are often very narrow passageways between buildings). Note: Google maps may not show the exact location of the hotel. Nice friendly service. Delicious breakfast goodies served on fine china. A true Venetian elegance. We found a couple of good restaurants nearby (although most close during the afternoon.) I will add what I tell anyone who goes to Venice -- be sure to visit the Gesuiti church (Santa Maria Assunta). It's not on most of the "must sees" but is simply breathtaking. It's clear on the other side of the island near the Fondamente Nuove vaporetto stop (where you get on the water bus to Murano) in northern Cannaregio. It was the last church we visited -- sort of a last minute decision -- and our favorite in Italy!

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way, but we loved it”
Reviews.Author: barbizondamazon
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Tiziano describes itself as "close to the train station," but it was a bit of a hike (over 6 bridges) with our bags. Still, once we found it, we were delighted. The hotel itself was beautifully restored, on a quiet residential street. The breakfasts were great - better croissants than we had in Paris! The staff spoke excellent English and were very helpful (my husband hurt his knee and we had to buy a cane, and they directed us to a place where we could find one). It was also quite cold when we visited Venice, but the room was snug and warm. Wifi service was good, too. We would definitely recommend the hotel, or use it again if (when) we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel if you are happy walking a bit”
Reviews.Author: SteveAndJac
Reviews.Content: Lovely quiet hotel with excellent rooms and breakfast. Staff are really helpful and free wifi is available. Quiet location on edge of Dorsoduro means that some walking is needed if only to vapourer to station. Not too far from P.le Roma if arriving from airport by express coach. We visited when very cold (canals frozen)but it was warm and comfortable inside.

Reviews.Title: “Location a little out of way, staff were friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Steve H
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in a family room 100 mtrs from hotel, room was modern and clean, staff were friendly. Only issue was location as we had too many bags after a long holiday and had to lug them though the streets to reach the hotel. Positive side was it was away from st marcos square which was v v touristy! Next time may look to a hotel closer to a ferry stop.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel, loved the room”
Reviews.Author: lissea
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very old and romantic. I loved our room - very spacious and clean. Our window's opened out overlooking a canal. Great AC. Clean bathroom. Nice breakfast. Staff at the front desk were not very friendly - but maybe that is their custom. Location is fairly close to the train station. If you have a lot of luggage you may want to take a water taxi as there are many bridges and the roads are cobblestone.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: NYPhysician
Reviews.Content: My experience in Hotel Tiziano was a positive one. The hotel is located in a quiet residential neighborhood of Venice. As much as this could be of benefit, this is also the ONLY drawback of this hotel. As it is located fairly in the interior of one of the six districts of Venice, getting there on foot could be a hassle if you don't have a comprehensive map of Venice. If you don't mind spending, you could take Venice's water-taxi and easily get there from Venice's train or bus station. If you travel from the airport by the Ali-Laguna boat, you need to get off at the stop called "Zattere." From there it is about 10-15 minutes by walk, provided you don't get lost in the smaller side-streets. These side-streets could be tricky for first-timers as you could either be going round and round without making any progress or reach a dead-end and may need to walk all the way back or you could be walking in a totally different direction. Barring this shortcoming, this is truly a great hotel to stay. The lobby itself suggests that it is a cosy place to stay. The room was very comfortable and clean. The bath/toilet was fairly spacious. The small drawback of the bathtub is its half-door (a door that extends from one end of the wall to half the length of the tub) causing water to spill out of the tub when you shower. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. They were nice enough to make free print-outs of some reservations that I had made after I reached Venice. I know many places in Europe where they charge a minimal fee for similar services. Internet was free and came in handy to make museum reservations online. Their breakfast is awesome. This came in handy as I was mostly traveling seeing places. After a good breakfast, I could postpone my meal until early in the evening concentrating more on sight-seeing and worrying little about where or when I would eat next. If I needed, I could grab a quick bite and go on. However, eating in Venice was not at all an issue as there are plenty of places with a wide range of prices! Overall, this was a pleasant and memorable stay, worth the price I paid for, barring the tedious walk to the hotel from the pier (upon arrival) and from the hotel to the train station (when I departed) carrying my bags across the numerous bridges of Venice (bridges connect to sides of a district as Venice is built on water).

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Peter L
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our four night stay at the Hotel Tiziano. Although the hotel is located away from the tourist attractions, we found the five minute walk to the Basilio vaporetto stop enabled us to use our 48 hour pass to visit all areas of Venice. Our room which had a canal view was clean quiet and comfortable.The buffet breakfast of cereals,fruit, yogurt,meat,cheese, bread and cakes set us up for the day. Staff were friendly and welcoming. We will stay at the Tizianio again.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful spot...”
Reviews.Author: Becky K
Reviews.Content: We loved Hotel Tiziano. It was such a peaceful location, about 15-20 minutes from the crowds of San Marco, in a residential area. There were several lovely restaurants about five minutes away. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, the rooms were larger than expected and the food excellent. I will definitely stay there the next time I'm in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: sfy8
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 days.. It is a bit far to walk to the st basilio station. We move around by vaportto as we bought a 3 day unlimited passes. We stayed in a 3 room apartment and the apartment is fully equipped with kichenette and so on. We did go to the wet market to get something to cook. We cook a lot as we are from Asia so we really need rice everyday. The breakfast is good. Very silence and quite area as it is away from city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: andronikkie189400
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel 3 days. I liked the location a lot. It is in a relatively residential area in Dorsoduro. We took the vaporetto from St Basilio station to commute. It is relatively far to walk to Piaza St Marko from there. I liked the fact that it is situated in a quiet area, so we could escape from all the tourists around St Mark's square. It is also a short walk from Piaza Santa Maragarita, which is very popular with students and has bars, cafes restaurants. The hotel had very good breakfast, free wifi and our room was spacious and quiet. The bathroom was excellent. However I found the decoration somehow run down. The price we paid was quite high, this is why I give it 3 stars, otherwise it would have been 4. Also the vaporetto from St Basiliio did not have the best connections.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in quiet area”
Reviews.Author: Muduke
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a quiet area of university. Excellent made service. Good breakfast with fruits and cakes. Away from city center and the crowds. Use GPS to go to the town, its about 15-20 minutes. Good choice if you like silence. Visit also Murano, Burano and Torcello island, the last one was Hemingways favorite island.

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: zenith20
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Tiziano in Venice in March 2011 for a week. The hotel was not bad for a three stay hotel, although there were no elevators, I had to take the stairs to get to the 3rd floor where my room was. Its a 3 star property in Europe so cant complain., But the staff were very friendly and nice.. Made you feel welcome It was a little hard to find at first, but once you find the hotel, its straight forward. Just a tip. Do not take the vaporetto to S.Basilio stop and walk to the hotel.. its longer and further from the vaporetto stop.... you are better off walking from P.de Roma as the hotel is only 10mins walk away. Had a great time in Venice and enjoyed authentic italian food as usual.. I got lost a couple of times in the alleyways but thats what Venice is known for :) The hotel rooms had free high speed internet which was very good.. Thats a plus!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location to access top 10 sights in Venice”
Reviews.Author: BobandMaggie60
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in the hotels 3 bedroomed appartment which was excellent as a base to explore Venice either walking or using the vaporetta and far enough away from the crowds to enjoy a peaceful district..It provided modern facilities ideal for self catering. The breakfast in the hotel was wonderful with a varied choice of cereals, yoghurt, fruit juice, breads, fresh fruit, ham and cheese and a delightful selection of cakes. Fresh tea and coffee and the cappucinno made for an ideal start to the day. The staff were always very helpful and polite and most spoke very good English. We tried the hotels restaurant Autorimessa at Piazza Roma which proved to be very good food, with huge portions and good service too at a discounted price for hotel residents. Don't be put off by the location of the restaurant by the bus station. Although there are no immediate opportunities for restaurants in the evening, near the hotel there are plenty to choose from within a 5 minutes walk and there is easy access to the vaporetta from San Basilo. We would definetly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful surprise”
Reviews.Author: milliontry
Reviews.Content: We booked in at the hotel wondering whether we were going too far. We discovered a few things that were a pleasant surprise intstead - the hotel is beautiful, lovely venetian decor in spacious rooms and a staff that goes out of their way in being incredibly helpful. The other wonderful aspect of our trip was that we had decided to 'hotel hop' staying one night in this hotel and another two nights close to San Marco.... if we had a choice, we'd have extended our stay at the Tiziano (or even ventured to another part of venice). We really enjoyed the local, out of the busy square part of venice. And the distances are not much!

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a place”
Reviews.Author: Zin2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked by my travel planner and we had no idea what to expect. Suffice to say, we were pleasantly surprised by this place. The front desk was very friendly, efficient, helpful and spoke excellent English. The place was very clean and looked relatively new. It was very cold and snowed in Venice when we were there but whole hotel was nicely heated. I had a nice loft room with a big bathroom and skylight. Free wireless too. We also arranged for a 5am checkout to catch the train and hotel kindly arranged early breakfast for us. Front desk young man helped to load the luggage onto the river taxi in -8C conditions. Place is also quite near the bus terminal and 1st stop for the river bus. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Inconvenient Location”
Reviews.Author: sixpact
Reviews.Content: Location - nice hidden gem hotel, but you have to walk about 20 mins from the train station to get there. It's also hidden a quite a maze that is Venice. Forget trying to follow a map unless you buy a very detailed one from one of the nearby stores. Food - good continental breakfast consisting of ham, prosciutto, cheese, yogurt, cereal, fruit, pastries, bread, butter, nutella, jam, milk, juice, and coffee. They prepared breakfast an hour early for us because we had to leave for the airport at 6 in the morning. Wi-fi Internet Connection - it was free and it worked! Service - nice staff. Usually has one person manning the front desk, most of the times it is a student (or college student aged). The manager/owner is there once in awhile. I broke a small table vase of theirs in their dining room, and they charged me 15 euros for it. I found out about the charge after I checked it - they never bothered to notify me ahead of time, which would have been more courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Webbo71046
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to Venice a number of times and this hotel is a gem, it can be a bit of a nightmare in the centre of Venice in the touristy season and this hotel is in a lovely residential area, 10 mins easy walk from the bus/train station. The rooms are clean and not a bad size for Venice and the staff are helpful. Just what you need if you are visiting! If I had to complain about anything it would be that there is no tea-coffee tray in the room, but let's be honest with the amount of cafes in this city, it wasn't really missed! Fantastic hotel, we will visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, quiet, and clean!”
Reviews.Author: paris19th
Reviews.Content: You can't do much better than this at any price! The location took a few turns to get to from the bus terminal, in the Dorsoduro quarter, but after about a 10 minutes walk, I was at the hotel. The decor of the room and bathroom is class, not cheap by any means. Breakfast was included and was plentiful and fresh too. You can ask why can't all hotels be as sweet as this!?

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: WorcesterSammy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tiziano for 3 days in mid July. A little apprehensive beforehand as my wife had booked it (!) and, looking at 'budget' hotels myself before we went, there were many with shared bathrooms, and others which looked unclean. However, fairplay to my wife, and much to my surprise this hotel was great! Our room was very clean and well equipped (TV, safe, Aircon, BATHROOM with shower, hairdryer and even a bidet!! - we even had a well stocked minibar). Our room even overlooked the canal at the side. Needless to say we were very satisfied. Staff were polite and friendly and all spoke good english and breakfast, although a bit basic and boring was adequate. All in all we couldn't grumble. The only thing that we could perhaps moan about was a time when we came back to the Hotel at about 6.30pm all hot, sweaty and bothered after another day of exploring every nook and cranny of Venice only to find the door locked and nobody on reception. After 10 minutes of banging on the door and constant ringing of the doorbell without success my wife knocked on the window of one of the groundfloor rooms and asked if one of the guests inside could come and open the door (which he did). When we got in i was gobsmacked to see that there were at least 8 guests sat in the breakfast room just opposite the reception!! They can all think themselves lucky for escaping a severe tongue lashing as i had, by that time, both nearly died of thirst and melted away! But, apart from that, The Tiziano gets a massive thumbs up and it's only a 10 minute walk from the bus station. As for Venice: loved it. Get yourself a token for the Vaporetta (canal bus) - it's well worth it as you can get around so much quicker and see all the sights. Visit the islands of Murano and Burano, and also take your Swimming costumes (if you visit in summertime) as there's a great beach on the island of Lido (also a short ride on the vaporetto). We had read that it's very busy and hot in july / aug - you're not kidding! Loads of japanese and americans, with several huge cruise liners in the port. But this wasn't a problem. What WAS a problem though was the heat and humidity. It was unbelievable! WARNING: do not wear any other colour top than white or black as it's only going to get drenched in sweat during those months - not nice, and rather uncomfortable, but at least you won't look like someone's thrown their pint at you. I'm sure i came back 6 pounds lighter than when i went! Thank god that we didn't have to share a bathroom back at the Hotel as that shower got some serious usage!! Also beware as 95% of restaurants / cafe's, etc add a service charge (which can be quite sizeable). Now, i don't object to giving a tip, infact much to my wifes dismay, i sometimes give one when it's not deserved - but what i DO object to is having to pay for the meal AND the staffs wages!!!! Not happy with that at all. On top of that a 'pint' of beer costs around 6 or 7 Euros (many of the prices are not shown on the food menus - again, beware). We weren't even eating in the more expensive locations either ( we had read somewhere that the quality and quantity of the food in Venice was poor compared to Italy in general, although i didn't really find that to be the case). We later went to a supermarket where the beer (for a large bottle) was priced between 45 and 75 CENTS! But "Hey" we all know that Venice isn't the cheapest place on earth, and a holiday wouldn't be the same without a bit of a winge, would it? Would we recommend The Tiziano? Yes, definitely Would we recommend Venice? Yes, without a doubt Would we recommend Sure 24 hour Protection Deodorant? You bet we would!

Reviews.Title: “Dosodoro Gem”
Reviews.Author: NomadJones
Reviews.Content: After traveling for 3 months in Europe I can say that Hotel Titziano was one of the nicest places we stayed in. With that being said, I think we got special treatment, because we scored one of the new flats that they have and it was amazing. We had three bedrooms a kitchen, a big bathroom and dining room. Great location in the Dosodoro and very nice staff. I'd recommend getting one of the flats in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: ivandimitroff
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in the main island of historical Venice and in the same time is at a quiet corner.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Scarlett27
Reviews.Content: Really lovely hotel in a quiet area near the university. Only a five minute walk from the S.Basilio vaporetto stop - all the major sites only a short boat ride away. Or you can walk to the city center - about 15-20 minutes. The lively Campo Santa Maria Margherita with bars and restaurants was close by. Our room was cozy and clean. Breakfast was served in a charming room -very special!!! and the consisted of cereals,yogurt,various fruits, Italian bread,ham, cheese- topped off with a homemade cake- superb! Coffee is made by request- always fresh....

Reviews.Title: “If you are satisfied with kitsch.”
Reviews.Author: Martez
Reviews.Content: Tiziano is located in a lovely area 10 minutes walk south of Piazza Roma. But only 4 minutes to the big canal with Vaporetto (=waterbus.) Make sure you know your way, when you arrive first time. ItÂ´s not easy to find with only a map. Since there are not street-name. But there are always people to ask. Here itÂ´s not as busy as in spot centre. Nice cafÃ©s and tavernas nearby. The hotel is very clean. Everything is in perfect order and function. Which is not too common in Venice. (Even dryer for clothes in the big bathroom!) My single room beside the reception looked nice, but was not 100% practical. No chair. No table. (Just a little thing beside the bed.) The bed was of good quality. (But if you like it very soft, itÂ´s not your kind of bed.) Breakfast was perhaps a little above standard, for a 3-star continental in Itally.( Which is below German standard.) Too much sweet cakes, for my taste. But coffee as good as in Sweden. The asian woman and the weekend -man, made you feel welcome. (But the same can not be said about everyone in the staff.) In my opinion the hotel did not offer a genuine Venice atmosphere. So I will not return. But if you donÂ´t share my opinion of whatÂ´s atmosphere, and think it is important with order and cleaness, you will like this hotel. (As most other critics do.)

Reviews.Title: “The hotel made my stay in Venice perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Lamexitraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a residential neighborhood, which made it perfect for my husband and me. We awoke to the sound of church bells, the voices of children walking to school and neighbor ladies discussing news of the day while sweeping in front of their homes.It is very quiet at night. We were there for my 50th birthday and the staff could not have been kinder. They arranged for a special cake, with candles and a big 50 on top, at breakfast and flowers in our room. Natalie was especially nice and the young lady who worked at breakfast (I've forgotten her name) was very sweet. The owner, a very distinguished lady, was good to us also. There are two restaurants nearby (the argentinian one and Pane i Vino) that are pretty good and easy to find. The hotel itself is a bit difficult to find, but we did it - at night and being severely jet-lagged. Just get good directions before you arrive. One can easily walk to the Piazzale Roma, Accademia and Peggy Guggenheim museums.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - HIGHLY recommend”
Reviews.Author: EditorsInc
Reviews.Content: Hotel Tiziano is a gem in Venice. Located in the Dorsoduro area - we found it a very quaint place to stay in a quiet neighborhood away from all noise and among the locals. We loved the marble floors, bathrooms, and elegant decor. Breakfast was fine and the neighborhood in general was awesome, near the San Basilio Vaparetto stop. You can also walk from the Academie area/stop as its on the same island, a bit of a walk, but not too bad. Neighborhood restaurants were amazing too (we had some of the best food on our trip in the nearby restaurants; nicer and cheaper than than the places near San Marco) I highly recommend, would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Serenity in La Serenissima”
Reviews.Author: NHFlutist
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Tiziano is a wonderful, genuine small hotel in the far southwest corner of the Dorsoduro sestiere. This was our 3rd time in Venice, and our first time staying in Dorsoduro. We stayed for 8 days and have nothing but good things to say about the hotel and the area. My wife and I had a double room on the second floor overlooking a small, quiet canal, and our friend had a small single on the ground floor overlooking the same canal. Our room was large, comfortable, and attractive with wood beam ceilings. The hotel staff is very helpful in giving advice and making reservations. They have a basic knowledge of English, and our Italian is very limited, but the language barrier was not a problem. The hotel is in a very quiet residential area. Several excellent restaurants are within a 10 minute walk. The San Basilio vaporetto stop is about 5 minutes away. The Ca' Rezzonico and the San Marta stops are about 10 minutes away. Piazzale Roma is a 10-15 minute walk, as is the Accademia Bridge. The breakfast room and tables are small but we were always able to find a table, even when the hotel was full (about 16 rooms). The breakfast buffet is pretty much standard at all European hotels frequented by tourists. The Tiziano's buffet is supplemented with a couple of homemade cakes each morning. On 2 or 3 mornings, there were no more croissants left by the time we made it to breakfast, but this may have been due to the earlier diners taking more than their share. Still it was disappointing. But, overall, we loved the Tiziano, would definitely go back, and recommend it highly, especially if you are going to be in Venice for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: horseshoehill
Reviews.Content: We loved this place....we went eight nights there recently and as people that live in rural America, the idea that something 15-20 minutes away via walking was "too far away" as some have mentioned was laughable. I do think this applies if you are 1-not good with a map (Venice IS a labyrinth, delightfully so) 2-have a hard time walking or are 3-overweight, but there were so many things to do just in the Dorsoduro that it is located in, you could never even visit St Marks and have a fine time. While there, the nearby things we enjoyed were the "freshest" coffee, cappucinos and espressos, juice and heavenly baked goods served in Hotel Tiziano from 8-10 every morning, the church bells of St Nicoli Medici and the place itself (a 1500 year old church around the corner) the five restaurants within spitting distance; Campo Santa Margherita and the Della Academia area, with the Guggenheim museum, and seeing the gondola repair shop and walking over the beautiful bridges, just taking pictures of the wonderful buildings and canals and the famous vegetable barge....."L" of Hotel Tiziano was particularly sweet and helpful, and I am sorry we did not get the other people's names- they made our trip of a lifetime so special.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fantastic serivce”
Reviews.Author: rescon
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a standard double on the first floor. The room was clean and bed comfortable although quite firm. Breakfast was buffet style with tasty cinnamon topped sponge cake & as much coffee /tea as you like. The Staff are friendly and helpful. A free wifi login is available from reception. The Hotel is located in a residential area, very quite a night and within easy walking distance of St Marks Square 25min. Eating out locally you have a fantastic pizza place 5 Euro for a full sized pizza and a great Argentinean restaurant a few doors away and that I strongly suggest you try. A supermarket is 8min walking on the sea front for daily essentials, and I would advise a packed lunch as once you hit the more touristy areas prices for food sky rocket. I would stay here again and have no qualms in recommending this fine establishment.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden Gem...”
Reviews.Author: RPB88
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Tiziano in September 2008 for a few nights and were pleasantly suprised: Positive: - Nice big clean room which was tastefully decorated considering that its a 14th century hotel - LCD TV with Italian and German Channels - Tasty breakfast with freshly made coffee of choice and fresh home made cakes/tarts every morning. Its seldom to get such a "fresh" breakfast in Italy. Almost no pre-packaged food in this hotel which was refreshing! - Very quiet and peaceful location as there are no roads/traffic in Venice, plus this hotel is not so close to the Grand Canal - Its far off the beaten tourist tracks around San Marco and Rialto Bridge, so it gives it a nicer feeling to stay between the canals of Venice, but away from the hoards of tourists. The back streets are quiet and actually very scenic. Negative: - No Internet connections in the rooms or at the hotel, so you have to look for an internet cafe. The internet cafes in this area close early (19:00). - It can be tricky to find when you arrive the first time, especially at night (Tip: Print out the PDF from Tiziano's home page in advance)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: DoctorSyntax
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to Venice. First time, a pricey hotel near St. Marks. Second time, an apartment in the Dorsoduro. Third time, used this site to search and decided on the Tiziano, which turned out to be perfect for us. We chose to disregard the complaints in some reviews that the hotel is "too far from Saint Marks" or "hard to find". Complaining that a Venice hotel isn't near Saint Marks is a bit like complaining that a New York Hotel isn't on Times Square. As for the "30-40 minute walk to Saint Marks" that one reviewer groused about, that's like saying that Times Square is difficult to reach by boat. Besides, everything in Venice - other than Saint Marks - is hard to find. The Tiziano is simple but elegant, spotlessly clean, air-conditioned, and efficiently run by a charming group of young signorinas. No, they did not offer to hump our suitcases up to our room, which would have been embarassing. Otherwise, they were cheerful and helpful. Observations: We splurged on one of their "junior suites", and got a nice-sized room on the second floor with windows on two sides, a little reading area, minibar, good bathroom and nice furnishings. The neighborhood is picturesque, residential, and very quiet. Tip 1: Since there's no way to see Venice without using the vaporettas, buy a pass as soon as you get there, and use it to get to the hotel. If you were driving or busing into Piazalle Roma or taking the train into Santa Lucia station, you'd hop onto the #2 boat, get off at San Basilio, and follow the directions the hotel provides from there. Flying in, you could take the 18 euro roundabout boat to Saint Marks via the Lido, or spluge 36 euros on the posh little boat which gets you there nonstop. I guess the economy option would be to take the bus to Piazalle Roma, and the splurge option the water taxi. Tip 2: Saint Marks is about ten minutes away on the same #2 from San Basilio. After exploring several delightful walking routes over to the Grand Canal, we found the fastest and most interesting was to cross the canal near the hotel at the Chiusa Sant Angelo Raffaele, follow the paving stones through the Campo past the Chiusa di Sant Sebastiano - just as if you were heading back to the San Basilio vaporetta stop - but when you cross the bridge on the other side of Sant Sebastiano, directly ahead of you there is what looks like a narrow alley, but quickly becomes a street with a lot of good restaurants and shops. It starts out as Calle Dell' Avogaria, changes names several times along the way, but takes you right down to the Ca' Rezzonico vaporetta stop on the Grand Canal in a straight shot. Less than 15 minutes for an aged, shambling, out-of-shape American. Tip #3: In the piazza behind the Chiusa Sant Agelo Raffaele, there is an outdoor restaurant called Pane Vino which became our favorite, as it obviously is with the local residents. Interesting menu - liked everything except the breadcrumb gnocchi - friendly service, excellent cheap house wines, and the best prosciutto I've ever tasted.

Reviews.Title: “Unspoiled Venice”
Reviews.Author: Italyeveryyear
Reviews.Content: This charming small hotel still manages to give one a sense of Venice before it was overrun by tourists. The neighborhood is still largely populated by Venetians, there are excellent restaurants nearby and the hotel itself has beautiful rooms ("Canaletto" is our first choice) and provides a first class breakfast with many homemade ingredients. The owners are extremely welcoming, nothing is too much trouble, and, with the help of a map, everything one wants to see is an easy walk or Vaporetto ride away. We will never stay anywhere else in Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Tiziano - great location”
Reviews.Author: MountaInbaby
Reviews.Content: Beautifully quiet and relaxing location, easy to find with explicit directions emailed from the hotel. It's an easy and interesting walk down a long straight street filled with shops and cafes to the grand canal, where it's then just a couple of stops on the vaperetto to St Marcs. Our room was very spacious, comfortable and clean. As mentioned previously, the 'service' at breakfast is of the irritated kind, although the food & drink itself are fine, with fresh cake, cheese, meat and yoghurts every day. The most astonishing thing to me was that, on check-out, the hotel insisted on charging us above the 'special internet' rate agreed by email (and, indeed, above the maximum rate displayed in the room). This soured the experience considerably. The best rate I found for this hotel was through asiarooms, at about 1/3 of the price of some other sites. Don't book direct would be my advice.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet small hotel”
Reviews.Author: violaidaho
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here three nights in September 2006. As others have mentioned, it was a little hard to find (we came from the bus station), but not too bad. Since we wanted to stay in a quiet area, it was perfect for us. We also needed to get to the bus station fairly early in the morning and it was only five minutes or so (once you knew the way!). We had a very nice corner room on the second floor, with high ceilings and lovely furnishings. The breakfast was good enough. Our hostess did not speak much English and was rather on the cold side, but overall this is a nice place for the price in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: aeropostale
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. It was beautiful and clean. Felt safe and secure. Downside was it took forever for us to find when we got there as the hotel website and Google maps were inconsistent and unhelpful. Yes, it's out of the way in a quieter neighborhood, so depending on your travel personality, this may not be for you. Otherwise it is in the Dorsoduro neighborhood and It's about a 15 minute walk to the nearest vaporetto. Could not tell you about the breakfast as we always left in the morning before we could try it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time.”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegosunshines
Reviews.Content: we were given a 3rd room floor, which was an attic loft. My son could not stand up! There is no elevator. It is in the middle of "NO WHERE". This is not the Venice that you see in travel brochures - beware. It is clean and neat, but it takes a 30 minute boat ride to arrive in a decent part of town! Stay in San Marcos instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: fromliverpool
Reviews.Content: For us, the delight of this hotel is that it is away from the tourist hell that is Piazza St Marco. It is a pleasant 20-30 minute walk to St Marco - yes, it must be visited, but it really is a rather ghastly experience. Just around the corner is the church St Nicolo dei Mendicoli. This is the church that Donald Sutherland was restoring in "Don't Look Now" and is a beautiful, welcoming little church, far more attractive than most of the larger ones in Venice. En route to the "main" sites is the Accedemia and Peggy Guggenheim's house - two of the delights of Venice for us. the other delight was simply walking around, exploring the less busy areas. If you don't like walking and just want to tick off "seen St Mark's" then maybe Tiziano is not for you. If you want character, comfort and peace at a reasonable price we recommend Tiziano. It is easily reached from the S Basilio water bus stop, but you will probably need to ask for directions as you get nearer as it is hidden from the main drag. If you reach S Nicolo Dei Mendicoli, just walk back along the canal by the church and you will see the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeeStaffordshire
Reviews.Content: Tiziano Hotel Venice Date 20th May 2007 We have just returned from a 3 day stay at the Tiziano Hotel. We can really recomend this hotel its beautiful. The staff are really pleasant and helpful. The hotel is a 20-25 min walk from St Marks square but around every corner there is something to do or see. Margerita square is 2 min walk and there you will find lovely restaurants, bars, shops ect. and very reasonably priced. The hotel has not got tea and coffee making facilities but they will provide you with a lovely tray of tea or coffee if you ask, much needed after walking all day and muchly appreciated. Everywhere is in walking distance,but definately get a map as soon as you arrive most people tend to get lost. We would definately go back to this hotel and its got aircon which was great when it was 32 deg. Thanks for a great stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: jones_g
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite a way from the main attractions of venice, St Marks square is probably a 30-40 minute walk, but this is my only complaint. The room we stayed in was spacious, the bathroom was really nice and the place was spotlessly clean. The room was cleaned every day. The breakfast was ok but not brilliant. There was a selection of cereals, cakes and bread with ham and cheese. I would recommend this hotel based on value for money but not location.

Reviews.Title: “very nice!”
Reviews.Author: ronski2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Tiziano hotel for 2 days. Its a very nice place to stay in venice. Its a little bit hard to find the hotel (locals helped us to get there) but once you figure it out it was easy to get to the san basilio vaporetto stop or to walk to the major sites. The hotel is in a very quiet area of the town (dorsoduro). The room is very cozy and clean. Breakfast is average. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting venice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel away from the madness”
Reviews.Author: junglek13
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Italy--Rome, Venice, Venice. Venice was a fantastic way to end the trip and the low-key nature of where we stayed was just what we needed. The area where the hotel was within easy walking distance to the tourist trap areas. I would say 20 minutes rather than the 30 some others say, but maybe we walk quick. Because of the way I had erroneously mapped it, we ended up wandering around trying to find the hotel from the train station, but it would have been easily walkable I think. It's fairly close to the bus station too, so that was helpful in getting to the airport!! It's the difference between a 3 euro bus and a 100 euro water taxi!! The rooms are gorgeous and the staff are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was quite ample--fruit (we didn't see fruit anywhere else), lovely cakes, rolls with cheese and jams, espresso, coffee, capuccinos. We were so surprised and excited to end our trip with this. Fabulous. Please see photos for the room and the view from the window.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous cosy hospitality”
Reviews.Author: SoloTravellerLondon
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this. Its in an extremely quiet area of town, but still within easy walking distance to the main centres. Also very close to the waterbus stops at San Basilo and San Marta, and getting around was easy on the regular waterbus service. Hotel was cosy and my room was warm, and although on a main square, was very quiet. The staff were very helpful indeed, and the breakfast was enough to set me up on a day's sightseeing. However, two tiny complaints, but not too serious. The bed was slightly uncomfortable, and as its close to a canal, there was a smell in the room, although I did get used to it after the first night.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice; a piece of a romantic past.....”
Reviews.Author: utazo81
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this nice hotel for 3 nights. We planed a romantic getaway and we choose the ideal hotel for this. The room (named Bellini - every room named by famous Italian personalities) was not very big (we had a room in the attic) but even then very roomy, and with all the comfort that you expect. It was very clean and the bathroom was the best surprise. As we booked we saw some pictures of the bathroom (with no shower curtain, no cabin), but we had a vat and a spacious bathroom with all the accesories you need in a bathroom. Breakfast was good. It was moore that you have in an American 3 star hotel, with Italian specialities. The hotel staff was very nice and helpful. Contra: - small corridor - no lift (but if this hotel had one, it would destroy the feeling) - no possibilities for lunch or dinner. - no smoking place (not even outside) I would recommend for everybody who loves warm and romantic places and would like to have a piece from the 18th century with the comfort of the 21th century....

Reviews.Title: “Cozy/warm”
Reviews.Author: Murrell
Reviews.Content: I had just been to Venice on business in August and decided to go back at the end of September for a week getaway by myself and stayed here at Hotel Tiziano. I loved it! I got turned around finding it, but the locals helped me and even escorted me to the hotel. I found it to be so quaint, nicely furnished, flat screen tv and mini bar and very important--VERY CLEAN and I thought it was a good price and definately worth the money. It is next to a small canal and in the mornings I would open the window for fresh air and hear the church bells ringing and see different sized rooftops! I loved it. They staff were so helpful too. The breakfast was nice every morning accommodating American and European style breakfasts served with a beautiful Italian cappuccino or espresso. I also really enjoyed staying in this area of the Dorso Duro district. It was more local and cozy giving me the day to visit all the busy places. I really enjoyed coming home everynight. There are a couple of good restaurants close by too. When I arrived at the airport, I took the water bus to get to the hotel. I enjoyed it because it was sunset, and I got to see all around Venice. It took about an hour on the bus and then 15 minutes by foot. On the day I checked out, I asked the hotel to call a water taxi for me to go to the airport. It is worth the money! I paid 90 Euros. Love it and would stay there again! Murrell K. Miami Beach, Fl

Reviews.Title: “Warm and cosy”
Reviews.Author: SL1985
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this pace with my boyfriend in October and really enjoyed. The staff were friendly but couln't speak very good english but we could still communicate fine. Even though it is out of the centre of Venice we found it in walking distance to everything. Only a 15 min walk to the train station also. The room was clean and cosy and maintained on a daily basis.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: europetravelr76
Reviews.Content: Hotel Tiziano is a very clean and cozy little hotel. This hotel was approximately a 30 minute walk to San Marco Piazza and the middle of Venice. It was a short walk from the water taxi to this hotel althougth the directions are a little confusing (Welcome to Venice!!HA) The breakfasts were great and hotel staff were always around to answer any questions we had. Although this hotel is a little off the beaten path it is a neat walk to the middle of Venice and is in a very safe area of town. I look forward to visiting Hotel Tiziano again in the future.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Tiziano
HotelInfo.Address: Dorsoduro 1873 | Sestiere di Dorsoduro, 30123 Venice, Italy
